userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: Property rights reside with the repository. Literary rights reside with the creators of the documents or their heirs. To obtain permission to publish or reproduce, please contact the Public Services Librarian of the Dept. of Special Collections.

custodhist.head: Provenance
custodhist.p: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Robet L. Duffus, 1970 and 1973.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation:
prefercite.p: [Identification of item] Robert L. (Robert Luther) Duffus Papers , M0203, Dept. of Special Collections, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: A collection of manuscript, and various printer's proofs (galley, page, production) of the books of Robert L. Duffus. Also included are tearsheets of articles and New York Times editorials by Mr. Duffus.
ADDITION INCLUDES manuscripts of books, newsclips, correspondence (mostly to Duffus)

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Robert Luther Duffus was born in Waterbury, Vt., July 10, 1888, the son of John McGlashan and Helen (Graves) Duffus. He obtained his A. B. from Stanford in 1910 and his A. M. in 1911. In addition, he was awarded an honorary L1.D. from Middlebury (Vt.) College in 1938.

Mr. Duffus was a reporter for the San Francisco Bulletin from 1911 - 1913 and editorial writer from 1913 to 1918. He then became an editorial writer for the San Francisco Call from 1918 - 1919 and for the New York Globe from 1919 - 1923. He has been a member of the editorial staff of the New York Times since 1937. Died, Nov, 28, 1972.

Among the honors awarded are the Chevalier, Legion of Honor and the Phi Betta Kappa Key. Mr. Duffus is an author with books including The Innocents at Cedro (1944), The Valley and Its People (1944), Non-Scheduled Flight (1950), Williamstown Branch (Memoirs) (1959), The Waterbury Record (1960), and The Tower of Jewels (1961).

By My Way - a series of articles of humorous commentary by R. L. Duffus, run in Nation's Business monthly from October 1948 to March 1956.Tearsheets.
A FAIR PROSPECT. A series of 57 booklets of humorous commentary by R. L. Duffus, published as advertising for Nation's Business, April 1944 to October 1948.
Miscellaneous clippings, tearsheets, and whole number periodicals of items by R. L. Duffus.
Scrapbooks of Clippings of New York Times Editorials by R. L. Duffus.
ADDITION Newsclips and Book Reviews re: Duffus.
Editorials written after retirement and Poems.
Tribute to Judge Learned Hand by R.L.D. Printed.
Newsclips and misc. re: R.L.D.'s death.
* JASON POTTER'S STAR WALK (later, SPACE WALK)
